pullRequest.body:
Also adds `isMulCentral_iff` using `mk_iff`.


---

(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they

nodes.body: ðŸš€ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by YaelDillies.

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7243780594/job/19731125125)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7243780594/job/19731125376)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7243780594/job/19731125208)
Annoyingly, this makes the lemmas have too many explicit arguments. Mind proving them by hand?
I'd rather you just file an issue to complain and we leave a TODO. There's no point having mk_iff at all if we never use it because it generates things badly.
I put `mulLeft` on the right because I considered that the simpler form. That may be a matter of taste though?
I don't really care either way, this change happened because I introduced `mulLeft_eq_mulRight_iff_forall_commute`. Do you want me to change it back?
